name: Criminal: Scumbag Stirling - Thronerunner
description:
Latest version built on Throne Runner.

Iain's ability may seem highly counter-productive. We like free money, but we don't like losing. Timing is crucial for installing your pieces in the right order and moment of the game. In a perfect world, the Corp is only at 2-3 points while you forfeit scored agendas for money or bad publicity. Keyhole destruction of the deck is the final end goal.

Keys to victory:

  • Install Logos as soon as possible in order to find Keyhole (Use keyhole to trash all agendas and win by decking Secondary) on the Corp's first score.

  • Frame Job any early agenda steals to Blackmail scoring remotes when the opportunity presents itself.

  • Mulligan aggressively for The Source, Logos and/or Mr. Li.

  • Do not hesitate to Data Deal agendas if necessary to proc Stirling's passive ability. (If attempting to win by decking your opponent)

http://twitch.tv/shammieg

http://youtube.com/thronerunner

name: Bankrupt Specialist
Open
With A Little Help From My Friends
description:
This is a deck idea I came up with to test out a new avenue for criminals. The thought process is to use Andi's larger than normal opening hand size and base link to set up a sound economy as early as possible. From there you have the unique tools of the deck to try and deal with any situation the Corp may place you in.

This is still a fairly early deck concept, and the lack of breakers may seem a bit odd to most, but I think that the potential for such an obscure deck is there, if you are willing to adapt to a different play style.

Obviously there are a few pit falls to the design. Being tagged is pretty terrible for you, and the fact that Crypsis is your only real breaker may cause some issues, but I think that a smart runner can respect the potential of this build if piloted correctly.

name: Cold Fusion Brain Freeze!
description:
Just a concept deck / idea based around the new Blue Sun ID for Weyland.

I was originally considering using Bioroid Efficiency Research in the deck to help abuse the corp's special ability, but Oversight AI in conjunction with Howler seemed to work better as you can pull trashed Janus's (... Out of interest; what is the plural of Janus?! Januses? Janusii? Janusae?!) out of Archives, Rez them and then use them as more fuel for money, or alternatively build a far more insane fortress!

Amazon Industrial Zone is there to make things cheaper, and the Security Subcontract to remove weak/unnecessary ice later on (such as the Howlers if all 3 Janus's are rezzed). Jackson Howard to pull out more cards from R&D or to pull from Archives should you need it, and Eliza's Toybox to make those expensive ice a tad more viable should things go horribly wrong.

Naturally, I have no idea how this would play out, but it was an interesting thought-experiment!

name: Here I Dreamt I Was An Architect
description:
This deck is a rather interesting one to me. At first, I didn't quite know what to do with Tennin. It seems designed to force the runner to make runs to stop its ability from triggering. This led me to two ideas, punish the runner for running aggressively (using its ability to irritate the runner for not attempting to win) or stonewall the runner with different types of "End the Run" effects, thereby triggering the base ability as often as possible.

The hope behind this deck is to use the knowledge runners have of Jinteki's tricks against them. With very little Ambush effects, "the fear" itself is the deterrent to running. Most Jinktei builds (at least in our local meta) have been filled to the brim with tons of nasty ways to ruin the runner's day. By using this fear we get to play an interesting game against the runner.

I think with the build presented here, we have the makings of a fun one time tourney deck. Once the trick is revealed that there is very little punishment for running, the deck will most likely fall apart.

name: The Chaos Dragon
description: This is an updated deck list from my previous deck. After having played this deck I can say that once set up this deck is a beast. Set up should be one Alpha Omega Magnum Opus and Wyrm with a way to recur your parasites. The full suite of hardware (three cyberfeeder and spinal modem) really allow you to run every turn and you can use cyberfeeder credits to install parasites as well. Don't forget that in a pinch Wyrm can break ice subroutines but at a pretty high price but I can attest that it has saved my butt a few times running three deep servers. The only card I'm on the fence on is RD interface as I have a hard time paying the install costs and I'm toying with the idea of throwing in False Echo hahaha as in play testing I've noted many instances where it's ability would have helped.

name: Jinteki - Brainscorch
description:
With Cerebral Cast being a thing now, I think that Jinteki Scorch decks are a bit more viable. Here's my take.

Strategy

As you can tell, this is a kill deck. Basically the first thing that you want to do is ice up your centrals with something painful, then rush out one of your utility agendas (usually Profiteering and/or House of Knives). Continue to build up your econ (don't be afraid to click for credits), then start looking for your kill pieces. While you are setting up for the kill, continue scoring some agendas to keep the pressure up and hopefully bait the runner into doing something stupid. Use Cerebral Cast to either give the runner enough brain damage to go for the Neural EMP kill, or land a tag for the scorch kill. This deck doesn't always need to flatline, however that is where most of my wins with it have come from. You definitely can still win by scorching agendas, and the 2 pointers really help facilitate that.

Notable Cards

Cerebral Cast - Obviously the workhorse in this deck. Don't start using it till mid game until you at least have an EMP or Scorch in your hand. Like I said, if they are taking brain damage, go for the EMP kill, if you land a tag, scorch them. If you need to, use a combination of both.

Tori Hanzo - She can hurt real bad. She helps you land extra brain damage in addition to what Cerebral Casts gets you. Put her over a server that the runner runs on often. I want to maybe find room for a third copy of her.

House of Knives - Also a very painful card. Combo it with Hanzo for guaranteed brain damage, or pop a counter before a deep R&D dig to threaten the flatline.

Profiteering - This is one of your main sources of econ. Scoring one of these early is very important, and the first one you score you should usually take all three BP. The second one that I score I'll usually only take two BP, and I tend to not score the third. Bonus points if you score a profiteering, then score a clone retirement next turn.

Celebrity Gift - This is an interesting one, because I am still having mixed feelings about it. With this deck, sometimes you don't mind revealing your hand, and sometimes you do. If you haven't been able to land any brain damage, and you have both your scorches in hand, then you usually don't want to use CG. However, if you are trying to go the brain damage/EMP route, showing the scorches in your hand can force the runner to take brain damage instead of a tag from Cerebral Cast. A possible replacement for this card could be hedge fund or restructure.

Problems

One of the main problems that I've been having with this deck is the ice. With such a low ice count, sometimes I'll even go two or three turns without seeing any, and that becomes very problematic. Net shield and Deus X can really cause some problems, Komainu and Ichi try to take care of those things though. Komainu to bait trashing Deus X, and Ichi tries to kill net shield, but they are not always successful at doing so. Speaking of Ichi, I don't know if it's what I should've spent my last 4 influence on.

I'd love to hear suggestions if anyone has any, especially on ice makeup and just general card choice.

name: Tokyo Lightning
description:
Based on http://netrunnerdb.com/en/decklist/5430/tennin-lightning-chicago-regionals-2014-

And i made few changes to be more relaiable deck.

Same : Cheap ETR, some program trashing, Trick of Light games and many advance. Never creating a remote other than Jackson.

Few changes:

NAPD over Nisei make hurt runner credit pockets.

NeoTokyo Grid makes much more reasonable to advance Ice Wall.

Commercialization is final result from advancing ice, even if its not Ice Wall. (Played to gain 3-10 credits) Subliminal gives you almost every turn 1 extra credit, with NeoTokyo Grid its 2 creds per turn.

Runner have usualy 1 turn window run free on RD

name: Thrashcan Whizzard v1.4
Box Of Chocolates Jinteki PE
description: You won't find two of the same thing in here - a huge variety of cards! Mostly just a fun deck to play :)

name: death by a 1000 nets
Isis Intelligence Operative
First Nisei
I Got the Blues
Servers, Servers Everywhere!
description: Get as many servers out as you can - traps, traps for all!

Andy Calling in Favors
description: Just brewed this up have no idea if anyone has already done this

name: Psionic Strike
Chaos of Account Siphon
description: First played deck. It ran smoothly into the shadows.

name: Strong in a Box
Fabulous Thunderbird
description: The idea is pretty simple: tax as much as possible, use Trick of Light to force agendas out when you can't score in the remote. Econ is mostly going to come from operations, but the GRNDL refineries have definitely done some work. I'm thinking of taking out the Ice Walls to free up influence since other ice works fine as ToL batteries anyway.
